document_title: Peripheral neuropathy: Causes, symptoms and treatments
subsection_content:
Complications of peripheral neuropathy may include:
Burns and skin wounds: The patient may not feel temperature changes or pain on frostbitten parts of the body.; Burns and skin wounds: People may not feel temperature changes or pain on frostbitten parts of the body.
Infection: Feet and other areas lacking sensation may be injured without the patient knowing. Doctor Vo Don advises that patients should check these areas regularly and treat small wounds to avoid infection, especially in patients with diabetes.; Infection: Feet and other areas lacking sensation may be injured without the patient knowing. Dr. Vo Don advises that patients should check these areas regularly and treat small wounds to avoid infection, especially in patients with diabetes.
Falls: Weakness and loss of feeling in the limbs can make the patient susceptible to losing balance and falling.; Falls: Weakness and loss of feeling in the limbs can make the patient more likely to lose balance and fall.
People with peripheral neuropathy are prone to falls due to loss of balance, so they need to pay close attention in daily life
